result.execSummary:
The defendant Autumn Marie Ruhl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours community service per week.

No contact with victim unless approved by agent.  

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances.

Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  Comply with SAFE intake program.  AODA and follow through.  

DNA sample. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: I/S to be used for rules violations.
I/S to be used for rules violations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Autumn Marie Ruhl

records.addlTxt: Probation review hearing on December 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 1:26 pm 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Deft appears in person, pro se; Agent Liesel Dille appears. 
COURT notes review of report. 
Probation Review set for 12/16/2022 at 1:15 pm. 
Adj: 1:27 pm
Probation review hearing on September 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Probation review hearing on September 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Clerk: Amanda. 
Case called at 9:20 am.
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry.  Defendant appears, pro se.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

PLEA to Ct.1(DC/Repeater[Domestic Abuse Assessments])>>GUILTY.  

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, defendant is competent to represent self, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 18 months probation; CONDITIONS: I/S 30 days MCJ for rule violations.  I/S 40 hours CS for rule violations. Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. NO contact with victim unless approved by agent. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances.  Comply with SAFE intake program.  AODA and follow through.  Pay CC/DV surcharge.  Pay DNA surcharge and provide sample. . 

COURT grants 1 days credit. 
Probation Review Hearing: 9/16 at 1:15 pm.
Adj: 9:28 am.

Pre-trial conference on June 1, 2022 at 10:50 am.
Final pre-trial on July 28, 2022 at 09:20 am.
Jury status hearing on August 30, 2022 at 02:20 pm.
Jury Trial on September 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Cash continued: No contact with victim(s): PPR; Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police (EMPD) escort to retrieve personal property from the residence.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 2:52 pm 
State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett; Defendant appears in person, pro se. 
Reading Waived.  
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

PLEA: Not Guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: $150 cash bond continues - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): PPR. 
- Police (EMPD) escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. 

BRANCH 3 CASE. 
PTC with JA: 6/1/2022 at 10:50 am. 
FPT: 7/28/2022 at 9:20 am. 
Jury Status Review: 8/30/2022 at 2:20 pm. 
Jury Trial:  9/8/2022 at 9:00 am.
